content.content: MIP41c5-SP8: Facilitator Offboarding (EVENTS-001)  Preamble MIP41c5-SP#: 8 Author(s): @Ippy Contributors: Tags: core-unit, events-001, cu-offboarding Status: Rejected Date Applied: 2022-06-22 Date Ratified:  Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip41c5-spxx-facilitator-offboarding-for-events-001/15992 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmTNaLnY#vote-breakdown   Sentence Summary I’m sure these are nice people, but this core unit is not needed and severance has been proposed.  Motivation See the sister sub proposal to remove the budget from this core unit. This core unit is simply not needed anymore. Severance is included in the budget offboarding sub proposal for both facilitators.  Core Unit ID EVENTS-001
content.GPT-summary: The post is an explanation of a proposal to offboard a core unit called EVENTS-001. The author argues that the core unit is no longer needed and proposes severance for the facilitators. The post also includes links to related sub-proposals and forums. A 3rd party gives negative feedback on the proposal, while another 3rd party provides constructive criticism.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I am happy to see people proposing budget cuts instead of just talking about budget cuts. I agree that this budget was very excessive and not what a DAO should be spending on, especially in a bear market.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: @ippy Would you be willing to withdraw this MIP (and sister) and try the new proposed process that starts with a Signal Request?

The largest MKR holder has expressed a desire for this to proceed. Using a SR and changing the process now would be inappropriate considering that 1) a SR is not sybil resistant, 2) that process has not been ratified, 3) the goal of that process is to stop spam. This proposal is clearly not spam based on the discussion in this thread. We cannot just change governance process willy nilly because one person puts a proposal forward. Using signal requests broadly is problematic because it gate-keeps MKR holder votes. This is already a noted problem. There needs to be a way to stop spam and not gatekeep MKR holder will. Signal requests do not achieve this. It puts the court of opinion ahead of MKR holder will. Any proposed process that does this is unlikely to be approved.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: It seems to me that the incentives to flood a signal request with sock puppets is very strong. CUs could also collectively vote against off-boardings and effectively protect each other from such requests. They have the numbers.

3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Nice to see we’re actively cutting the budget with concrete steps. Hoping to see more of these to trim the fat.
